articles.description: Wales will be one win away from Euro 2024 if they beat Finland in their home play-off semi-final on Thursday.
articles.title: Wales braced for crunch Finland Euro play-off

articles.description: Susie Wolff takes legal action against motorsport's governing body the FIA following its controversial conflict of interest inquiry into her last year
articles.title: F1: Susie Wolff takes legal action after controversial conflict of interest inquiry

articles.description: Former Australia captain Meg Lanning is selected by London Spirit in The Hundred draft but David Warner misses out.
articles.title: Warner misses out in The Hundred draft

articles.description: Australian Open champion Aryna Sabalenka asks for privacy after the 'unthinkable tragedy' of the death of her former boyfriend.
articles.title: Aryna Sabalenka: Konstantin Koltsov death in Miami is 'unthinkable tragedy'

articles.description: Manchester United's 18-year-old midfielder Kobbie Mainoo says he is targeting a place in England's Euro 2024 squad after a "mad couple of days".
articles.title: Mainoo eyes Euros spot after 'mad couple of days'

articles.description: Former Manchester City and Real Madrid forward Robinho must serve a nine-year rape sentence in his home country of Brazil, a court rules.
articles.title: Ex-Brazil star Robinho told to serve nine-year rape sentence

articles.description: Formula 1's governing body clears its president Mohammed Ben Sulayem of claims he interfered with races in Saudi Arabia and Las Vegas last season.
articles.title: Formula 1: FIA clears its president Mohammed Ben Sulayem over race interference claims

articles.description: Saracens fly-half Owen Farrell remains "happy" with his decision to step away from England and is focusing on enjoying his rugby again.
articles.title: Farrell still 'happy' with England decision

articles.description: Former Arsenal winger Paul Merson says football is "ravaged" with gambling and the bans given to Ivan Toney and Sandro Tonali are a "disgrace".
articles.title: Toney and Tonali gambling bans a disgrace - Merson

articles.description: Andy Murray earns a much-needed win over an ailing Matteo Berrettini in Miami, with fellow Briton Jack Draper also through.
articles.title: Miami Open: Andy Murray beats Matteo Berrettini, Jack Draper also through
